notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow remote code execution.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Chemical, Commercial Facilities, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Transportation Systems, Water and Wastewater Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends that users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: This vulnerability is exploitable locally. No known public exploits specifically target this vulnerability.
notes.title: Exploitability

document.title: LCDS - Leão Consultoria e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas Ltda ME LAquis SCADA ELS Files

branches.name: LCDS LeÃ£o Consultoria e Desenvolvimento de Sistemas LTDA ME

notes.text: Opening specially crafted ELS file may result in a write past the end of an allocated buffer, which may allow an attacker to execute remote code in the context of the current process.CVE-2019-6536 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.8 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: LCDS recommends users update to Version 4.3.1.71, which can be found at the following location:
